frame.name: Biological_classification
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame has to do with scientific taxonomy. The lexical units in this frame include the seven major classifications in which organisms are grouped based on common biological characteristics. These classifications are labeled <fen>Rank</fen> in this frame. The <fen>Member</fen>s or <fen>Subtype</fen> of the <fen>Rank</fen> is often expressed with the use of the target-denoting noun. <ex></ex> <ex><t><fex name="Rank">Phylum</fex></t> <fex name="Sub">Arthropoda</fex> <m>contains</m> <fex name="Mem">crustaceans, insects, spiders and other creepy-crawlies</fex>.</ex> <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Mem">The snow leopard</fex> <m>belongs</m> to the <t><fex name="Rank">kingdom</fex></t> <fex name="Sub">Animalia</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rank
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Rank</fen> is the taxonomic category to which the <fen>Member</fen> belongs. It is also always the target-denoting noun.
<ex>Molds and mushrooms belong to the <t><fex name="Rank">kingdom</fex></t> Fungi.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Member
FE.definition:
<def-root>The living organism which belongs to the expressed <fen>Rank</fen>.
<ex>The <t>genus</t> Homo <m>includes</m> <fex name="Mem">modern humans</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subtype
FE.definition:
<def-root>The subtype of the <fen>Rank</fen>.
<ex>Do humans belong to the <t>order</t> <fex name="Sub">Primate</fex>?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Property
FE.definition:
<def-root>A property of the <fen>Member</fen> of the <fen>Rank</fen>.
<ex>Members of the <t>phylum</t> Cycliophora <m>have</m> <fex name="Prop">a circular mouth</fex>.</ex></def-root>
